panama.core
Class BaseController

java.lang.Object
  panama.core.BaseController
Direct Known Subclasses:
SystemController, TableController, TreeController
public class BaseController
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for all controllers.

Robert

Method Detail

beforeAction

public void beforeAction(java.lang.String actionName)
                  throws ForceTargetException,
                         AuthorizationException
This method is invoked every time, before an action of this controller is invoked by the dispatcher. Default implemention does nothing. Useful to overwrite and put e.g. needed things into context or do authorization

Parameters:
actionName - The name of the action to be invoked later on
Throws:
ForceTargetException - If necessary, this method may throw this exception to force a specific target (e.g. for checking login)
AuthorizationException - If necessary, this method may throw this exception to force a HTTP-Response of 403 (forbidden)

afterAction

public void afterAction(java.lang.String actionName,
                        Target target)
                 throws ForceTargetException
This method is invoked every time, after an action of this controller has been. invoked by the dispatcher. Default implementation does nothing. Overwrite it if you need things to be done after most or all of your actions.

Parameters:
actionName - The name of the action to be invoked later on
target - The result of the action
Throws:
ForceTargetException - If necessary, this method may throw this exception to force a specific target (e.g. for checking login)

redirect

public RedirectTarget redirect(java.lang.String url)
Defines a redirect to other url (relative or absolute). Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL. This method can accept relative URLs; the servlet container must convert the relative URL to an absolute URL before sending the response to the client. If the location is relative without a leading slash (/) the container interprets it as relative to the current request URI. If the location is relative with a leading slash (/) the container interprets it as relative to the webapp. To redirect to other action use redirectToAction(String, String...) or redirectToAction(Class, String, String...) Note: Use redirect only if you need the client browser's URL to have a new URL.

Parameters:
url -
Returns:
A Target object

redirectToAction

public Target redirectToAction(java.lang.String action,
                               java.lang.String... optionalParamsAndValues)
Defines a redirect to other action. Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using a URL created from the current Controller and the specified action and parameters The URL has the form: ../controllerName/action?param1=value1¶m2=value2... The parameter names and values are url-encoded by this method. Note: Use redirect only if you need the client browser's URL to have a new URL. Its much faster to use simply invoke the method of the required action and return it's result.

Parameters:
action -
optionalParamsAndValues - an optional list of parameters and values, alternating like so: param1, value1, param2, value2...
Returns:
A Target object

redirectToAction

public Target redirectToAction(java.lang.Class<? extends BaseController> controllerClass,
                               java.lang.String action,
                               java.lang.String... optionalParamsAndValues)
Defines a redirect to other action. Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using a URL created from the specified controllerClass, action and the specified action and parameters The URL has the form: ../controllerName/action?param1=value1¶m2=value2... The parameter names and values are url-encoded by this method. Note: Use redirect only if you need the client browser's URL to have a new URL. Its much faster to use simply invoke the method of the required action and return it's result.

Parameters:
controllerClass -
action -
Returns:
A Target object

render

public Target render(java.lang.String templateName)
Creates a TemplateTarget for the specified templateName (building absolute path is a relativ path was provided)

Parameters:
templateName - The name (with relative or absolute path) of the template to render
Returns:
a Target object

executeAction

public Target executeAction(java.lang.String actionName,
                            java.lang.String... optionalParamsAndValues)
                     throws ForceTargetException,
                            NoSuchActionException,
                            HttpErrorException
Executes an action of the same controller with an optional set of parameters. After execution, the original parameters are restored.

Parameters:
actionName - Name of the action
optionalParamsAndValues - an optional list of parameters and values, alternating like so: param1, value1, param2, value2...; These replace the original parameters during the execution of the action.
Returns:
The resulting Target of the executed action
Throws:
ForceTargetException
NoSuchActionException
HttpErrorException

registerTable

public Table registerTable(Table initialTable)
If no table with specified key exists in current session, a new entry with the specified initialTable is created and returned, otherwise the already existing table is returned. In any case, the table is put into request scope using it's key as key.

Parameters:
initialTable -
Returns:
existing or initial table

getTable

public Table getTable(java.lang.String tableId)
Gets a table from the table-map in session scope.

Parameters:
tableId - Unique ID
Returns:
a Table

registerTree

public Tree registerTree(Tree initialTree)
If no tree with specified key exists in current session, a new entry with the specified initialTree is created and returned, otherwise the already existing tree is returned.

Parameters:
initialTree -
Returns:
the existing or initial Tree object

getTree

public Tree getTree(java.lang.String treeId)
Gets a tree from the tree-map in session scope.

Parameters:
treeId - Unique ID
Returns:
A Tree object
